snippet: Legislators voted against a plan backed by Gov. Sam Brownback that would have raised sales taxes, but the move means the state may face deep cuts to schools.
abstract: Republican-controlled House in Kansas rejects plan by Gov Sam Brownback to raise sales and cigarette taxes to close ballooning budget deficit; failure will likely result in $197 million cut to education, as well as additional cuts to prisons and other programs.
lead_paragraph: Legislators voted against a plan backed by Gov. Sam Brownback that would have raised sales taxes, but the move means the state may face deep cuts to schools.

headline.main: Governor of Kansas Is Denied in Tax Battle
headline.print_headline: Governor of Kansas Loses Out in Tax Fight
